main_definition: A webcast is a media presentation distributed over the Internet using streaming media technology, typically in real-time, allowing viewers to watch live events or broadcasts online.

meanings_and_examples.example: The tech conference was webcasted so that attendees could watch the presentations from anywhere in the world.
An educational institution hosted a weekly webcast featuring guest speakers discussing various academic topics, and viewers could ask questions through chat functions.
The company held its annual shareholders meeting via webcast, allowing stakeholders to tune in remotely without attending the physical event.
